channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SODA: Robust Training of Test-Time Data Adaptors
item.description: Adapting models deployed to test distributions can mitigate the performance degradation caused by distribution shifts.

item.title: Efficiently Visualizing Large Graphs
item.description: Performing SPLEE to obtain a high-dimensional embedding of the large-scale graph and then using t-SGNE to reduce its dimension for visualization, we are able to visualize graphs with up to 300K nodes and 1M edges within 5 minutes and achieve approximately 10% improvement in visualization quality.

item.title: Adaptive Pairwise Encodings for Link Prediction
item.description: In recent years, a new class of methods has emerged that combines the advantages of message-passing neural networks (MPNN) and heuristics methods.

item.title: xMEN: A Modular Toolkit for Cross-Lingual Medical Entity Normalization
item.description: Weakly supervised cross-encoders are effective when no training data is available for the target task.

item.title: NICE: Improving Panoptic Narrative Detection and Segmentation with Cascading Collaborative Learning
item.description: To address this, we introduce two cascading modules based on the barycenter of the mask, which are Coordinate Guided Aggregation (CGA) and Barycenter Driven Localization (BDL), responsible for segmentation and detection, respectively.

item.title: An Empirical Study of Translation Hypothesis Ensembling with Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) are becoming a one-fits-many solution, but they sometimes hallucinate or produce unreliable output.

item.title: Sparse-DySta: Sparsity-Aware Dynamic and Static Scheduling for Sparse Multi-DNN Workloads
item.description: Running multiple deep neural networks (DNNs) in parallel has become an emerging workload in both edge devices, such as mobile phones where multiple tasks serve a single user for daily activities, and data centers, where various requests are raised from millions of users, as seen with large language models.

item.title: EXMODD: An EXplanatory Multimodal Open-Domain Dialogue dataset
item.description: The need for high-quality data has been a key issue hindering the research of dialogue tasks.

item.title: Understanding Contrastive Learning via Distributionally Robust Optimization
item.description: This study reveals the inherent tolerance of contrastive learning (CL) towards sampling bias, wherein negative samples may encompass similar semantics (\eg labels).

item.title: Towards Generic Semi-Supervised Framework for Volumetric Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: As a result, there is growing interest in using semi-supervised learning (SSL) techniques to train models with limited labeled data.

item.title: Watermarking LLMs with Weight Quantization
item.description: Abuse of large language models reveals high risks as large language models are being deployed at an astonishing speed.

item.title: Unanswerable Visual Question Answering
item.description: Teaching Visual Question Answering (VQA) models to abstain from unanswerable questions is indispensable for building a trustworthy AI system.

item.title: Evaluating LLMs for Privilege-Escalation Scenarios
item.description: We explore the intersection of LLMs and penetration testing to gain insight into their capabilities and challenges in the context of privilige escalation.

item.title: TEQ: Trainable Equivalent Transformation for Quantization of LLMs
item.description: As large language models (LLMs) become more prevalent, there is a growing need for new and improved quantization methods that can meet the computationalast layer demands of these modern architectures while maintaining the accuracy.

item.title: Compatible Transformer for Irregularly Sampled Multivariate Time Series
item.description: To analyze multivariate time series, most previous methods assume regular subsampling of time series, where the interval between adjacent measurements and the number of samples remain unchanged.

item.title: Fast and Simple Spectral Clustering in Theory and Practice
item.description: Spectral clustering is a popular and effective algorithm designed to find $k$ clusters in a graph $G$.

item.title: In-Context Few-Shot Relation Extraction via Pre-Trained Language Models
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, we are the first to reformulate the relation extraction task as a tailored in-context few-shot learning paradigm.

item.title: VcT: Visual change Transformer for Remote Sensing Image Change Detection
item.description: Then, each pixel of feature map is regarded as a graph node and the graph neural network is proposed to model the structured information for coarse change map prediction.

item.title: An active learning convolutional neural network for predicting river flow in a human impacted system
item.description: Here we find that a convolutional Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) network is well suited to modeling flow in parts of this basin that are strongly impacted by water projects as well as ones that are relatively free from direct human modifications.

item.title: Instilling Inductive Biases with Subnetworks
item.description: Our method discovers a functional subnetwork that implements a particular subtask within a trained model and uses it to instill inductive biases towards solutions utilizing that subtask.

item.title: A Modified EXP3 and Its Adaptive Variant in Adversarial Bandits with Multi-User Delayed Feedback
item.description: Thus, we formulate an adversarial multi-armed bandit problem with multi-user delayed feedback and design a modified EXP3 algorithm named MUD-EXP3, which makes a decision at each round by considering the importance-weighted estimator of the received feedback from different users.

item.title: A voxel-level approach to brain age prediction: A method to assess regional brain aging
item.description: Brain aging is a regional phenomenon, a facet that remains relatively under-explored within the realm of brain age prediction research using machine learning methods.

item.title: Agent-Specific Effects
item.description: These challenges are particularly prominent in the context of multi-agent sequential decision-making, where the causal effect of an agent's action on the outcome depends on how the other agents respond to that action.

item.title: Heterogenous Memory Augmented Neural Networks
item.description: It has been shown that semi-parametric methods, which combine standard neural networks with non-parametric components such as external memory modules and data retrieval, are particularly helpful in data scarcity and out-of-distribution (OOD) scenarios.

item.title: Dual Cognitive Architecture: Incorporating Biases and Multi-Memory Systems for Lifelong Learning
item.description: Artificial neural networks (ANNs) exhibit a narrow scope of expertise on stationary independent data.

item.title: IMTLab: An Open-Source Platform for Building, Evaluating, and Diagnosing Interactive Machine Translation Systems
item.description: We present IMTLab, an open-source end-to-end interactive machine translation (IMT) system platform that enables researchers to quickly build IMT systems with state-of-the-art models, perform an end-to-end evaluation, and diagnose the weakness of systems.

item.title: Neural Attention: Enhancing QKV Calculation in Self-Attention Mechanism with Neural Networks
item.description: In the realm of deep learning, the self-attention mechanism has substantiated its pivotal role across a myriad of tasks, encompassing natural language processing and computer vision.

item.title: Zipformer: A faster and better encoder for automatic speech recognition
item.description: The Conformer has become the most popular encoder model for automatic speech recognition (ASR).

item.title: QADYNAMICS: Training Dynamics-Driven Synthetic QA Diagnostic for Zero-Shot Commonsense Question Answering
item.description: Zero-shot commonsense Question-Answering (QA) requires models to reason about general situations beyond specific benchmarks.

item.title: MonoSKD: General Distillation Framework for Monocular 3D Object Detection via Spearman Correlation Coefficient
item.description: Monocular 3D object detection is an inherently ill-posed problem, as it is challenging to predict accurate 3D localization from a single image.

item.title: PELA: Learning Parameter-Efficient Models with Low-Rank Approximation
item.description: This allows for direct and efficient utilization of the low-rank model for downstream tasks.

item.title: Active Learning Framework for Cost-Effective TCR-Epitope Binding Affinity Prediction
item.description: To reduce annotation cost, we present ActiveTCR, a framework that incorporates active learning and TCR-epitope binding affinity prediction models.

item.title: Probabilistic Classification by Density Estimation Using Gaussian Mixture Model and Masked Autoregressive Flow
item.description: A family of density estimators is mixture models, such as Gaussian Mixture Model (GMM) by expectation maximization.

item.title: Building Persona Consistent Dialogue Agents with Offline Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Our automatic and human evaluations show that our framework improves both the persona consistency and dialogue quality of a state-of-the-art social chatbot.

item.title: DemoNSF: A Multi-task Demonstration-based Generative Framework for Noisy Slot Filling Task
item.description: Recently, prompt-based generative frameworks have shown impressive capabilities in sequence labeling tasks.

item.title: SoTTA: Robust Test-Time Adaptation on Noisy Data Streams
item.description: To address this problem, we present Screening-out Test-Time Adaptation (SoTTA), a novel TTA algorithm that is robust to noisy samples.

item.title: Image super-resolution via dynamic network
item.description: In this paper, we present a dynamic network for image super-resolution (DSRNet), which contains a residual enhancement block, wide enhancement block, feature refinement block and construction block.

item.title: Multi-Body Neural Scene Flow
item.description: The test-time optimization of scene flow - using a coordinate network as a neural prior - has gained popularity due to its simplicity, lack of dataset bias, and state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: Continual Generalized Intent Discovery: Marching Towards Dynamic and Open-world Intent Recognition
item.description: In a practical dialogue system, users may input out-of-domain (OOD) queries.

item.title: OpenAgents: An Open Platform for Language Agents in the Wild
item.description: Language agents show potential in being capable of utilizing natural language for varied and intricate tasks in diverse environments, particularly when built upon large language models (LLMs).

item.title: A Survey on Video Diffusion Models
item.description: However, existing surveys mainly focus on diffusion models in the context of image generation, with few up-to-date reviews on their application in the video domain.

item.title: On the Transferability of Learning Models for Semantic Segmentation for Remote Sensing Data
item.description: Yet, there is no comprehensive analysis of their transferability, i. e., to which extent a model trained on a source domain can be readily applicable to a target domain.

item.title: Real-time Photorealistic Dynamic Scene Representation and Rendering with 4D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Reconstructing dynamic 3D scenes from 2D images and generating diverse views over time is challenging due to scene complexity and temporal dynamics.

item.title: Implicit regularization via soft ascent-descent
item.description: As models grow larger and more complex, achieving better off-sample generalization with minimal trial-and-error is critical to the reliability and economy of machine learning workflows.

item.title: Can Word Sense Distribution Detect Semantic Changes of Words?
item.description: Given this relationship between WSD and SCD, we explore the possibility of predicting whether a target word has its meaning changed between two corpora collected at different time steps, by comparing the distributions of senses of that word in each corpora.

item.title: DNA: Denoised Neighborhood Aggregation for Fine-grained Category Discovery
item.description: Specifically, we retrieve k-nearest neighbors of a query as its positive keys to capture semantic similarities between data and then aggregate information from the neighbors to learn compact cluster representations, which can make fine-grained categories more separatable.

item.title: Learning visual-based deformable object rearrangement with local graph neural networks
item.description: Our method reaches much higher success rates on a variety of deformable rearrangement tasks (96. 3% on average) than state-of-the-art method in simulation experiments.

item.title: A cross Transformer for image denoising
item.description: To avoid loss of key information, PB uses three heterogeneous networks to implement multiple interactions of multi-level features to broadly search for extra information for improving the adaptability of an obtained denoiser for complex scenes.

item.title: Large Language Models Meet Open-World Intent Discovery and Recognition: An Evaluation of ChatGPT
item.description: The tasks of out-of-domain (OOD) intent discovery and generalized intent discovery (GID) aim to extend a closed intent classifier to open-world intent sets, which is crucial to task-oriented dialogue (TOD) systems.

item.title: ZoomTrack: Target-aware Non-uniform Resizing for Efficient Visual Tracking
item.description: To this end, we non-uniformly resize the cropped image to have a smaller input size while the resolution of the area where the target is more likely to appear is higher and vice versa.
